intro: Calystegia japonica f. vulgaris, commonly known as the Japanese morning glory, is a flowering plant characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet to blue flowers. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is native to East Asia. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and a trailing growth habit, often climbing or spreading along the ground. Its flowers open in the morning and close in the afternoon, hence its common name. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant.
